briefing:
## 🌍 Top 5 Global Fintech News

- **[Fintech founder charged with fraud; AI app found to be humans in the Philippines](https://techcrunch.com/2025/04/10/fintech-founder-charged-with-fraud-after-ai-shopping-app-found-to-be-powered-by-humans-in-the-philippines/)** — *Hacker News* — A fintech founder faces fraud charges after their supposedly AI-powered shopping app was revealed to be operated by human workers in the Philippines.

- **[Americans see their savings vanish in Synapse fintech crisis](https://www.cnbc.com/2024/11/22/synapse-bankruptcy-thousands-of-americans-see-their-savings-vanish.html)** — *Hacker News* — Thousands of Americans lost access to their savings following the collapse of fintech middleware firm Synapse, raising urgent questions about consumer protections in embedded finance.

- **[Apple acquires UK open banking startup Credit Kudos](https://ffnews.com/newsarticle/apple-acquires-uk-open-banking-startup-credit-kudos/)** — *Hacker News* — Apple acquired UK-based open banking startup Credit Kudos, signalling the tech giant's growing interest in leveraging financial data for credit and payments services.

- **[Open Banking and Payments Competition](https://www.bitsaboutmoney.com/archive/open-banking-and-payments-competition/)** — *Hacker News* — A deep dive into how open banking frameworks are reshaping payments competition and what it means for incumbents and challengers alike.

- **[Fintech is making credit cards weirder](https://workweek.com/2022/08/05/fintech-is-making-credit-cards-weirder/)** — *Hacker News* — Fintech innovation is pushing credit cards into increasingly niche and unconventional territory, from crypto rewards to embedded lending features.

---

## 🍁 Top 5 Canadian Fintech News

- **[Wealthsimple named CIX Innovator of the Year](https://betakit.com/wealthsimple-named-cix-innovator-of-the-year/)** — *BetaKit* — Canadian fintech leader Wealthsimple has been recognized as CIX Innovator of the Year, highlighting its continued impact on democratizing financial services in Canada.

- **[Canadian Bitcoin Consortium launches insurance company for digital asset businesses](https://betakit.com/canadian-bitcoin-consortium-launches-insurance-company-for-digital-asset-businesses/)** — *BetaKit* — The Canadian Bitcoin Consortium has launched a dedicated insurance company to provide coverage for digital asset businesses, addressing a significant gap in the crypto industry's risk management infrastructure.

- **[Canadian businesses expect more uncertainty as US Supreme Court strikes down Trump's tariffs](https://betakit.com/canadian-businesses-expect-more-uncertainty-as-us-supreme-court-strikes-down-trumps-tariffs/)** — *BetaKit* — Despite the US Supreme Court ruling against Trump's sweeping tariffs, Canadian businesses say they anticipate continued economic uncertainty rather than relief.

- **[Canada's annual inflation rate edged down to 2.3% in January with decline in gas prices](https://www.cbc.ca/news/business/canada-inflation-cpi-january-2026-9.7093329?cmp=rss)** — *CBC Business* — Canada's inflation rate dipped to 2.3% in January 2026, a signal with implications for Bank of Canada rate decisions and consumer lending conditions across the fintech sector.

- **[Canada calls screen scraping 'unsecure,' sets Open Banking target for 2023](https://finledger.com/2021/08/09/canada-sets-open-banking-target-for-2023/)** — *Hacker News* — *(Relevant from global pool)* Canada's government flagged screen scraping as a security risk and set an open banking implementation target, a foundational moment in Canada's still-evolving open banking journey.

---

## 🌊 Bonus: Relevant to Atlantic Fintech's Focus (1–3 articles)

- **[Fintech dystopia](https://fintechdystopia.com/)** — *Hacker News* — A thought-provoking resource cataloguing the risks, failures, and unintended consequences of fintech innovation — a useful lens for ecosystem builders prioritizing responsible fintech development in Atlantic Canada.

- **[Trump Boosts New Tariff Rate to 15% a Day After Announcing 10%](https://financialpost.com/pmn/business-pmn/trump-says-he-will-increase-global-tariffs-to-15-from-10)** — *Financial Post* — Escalating US tariff uncertainty poses direct economic pressure on Atlantic Canadian businesses and may influence cross-border fintech investment and payments flows in the region.

- **[Cohere co-founder Nick Frosst wants to build more Canadian, less Silicon Valley-centric AI](https://betakit.com/cohere-co-founder-nick-frosst-wants-to-build-more-canadian-less-silicon-valley-centric-ai/)** — *BetaKit* — Cohere co-founder Nick Frosst's push for a distinctly Canadian AI ecosystem resonates with Atlantic Fintech's mission of growing homegrown innovation rather than ceding ground to US tech giants.
